intro: Stephanodoria, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have opposite, ovate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white. They are often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in wetland environments. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and floral displays.
